content.1: Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name
content.2: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
content.3: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
content.4: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah. All these
content.5: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
content.6: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
content.8: Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full
content.9: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which
content.10: The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
content.11: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahai-roi.
content.14: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
content.15: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
content.18: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that
content.20: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padan-aram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
content.22: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If
content.24: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold,
content.25: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
content.26: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau’s heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac
content.27: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob
content.28: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of
content.29: And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he
content.30: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red
content.31: And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.
content.33: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
content.34: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised
